reviews.title: Absolute Joke
reviews.pros: Great Tech Great work / life balance in most BUs Above average pay Bonus People in TAPs BU (bar American management globally)
reviews.cons: Outdated business model - barely anyone under 40s uses the site let alone leaves reviews. New CEO hired a well known external consultancy at a huge cost and output was to be a 'mobile first' company. Senior management in certain BU are more interested in rewarding personal friendships then doing whats right for the business. Business pretends to be have a global approach but in reality is a US driven business that applies the same strategy globally. Text book US company behaviour.
reviews.advice: Carry on replacing the old C suite and clear out the dead wood from Conde Nast. Fresh, new faces with new ideas are needed in Media that have the businesses best interests at heart.

reviews.title: Great company to work for
reviews.pros: -Fantastic office (Needham, MA) -Hybrid work model -Free, high quality in-office lunch (hot and cold) -Great people to work with -Solid leadership -Good brand
reviews.cons: -Recent layoffs -Not competitive in certain markets -Some disorganization in the division I worked in (restaurants) -Training was absolutely abysmal
reviews.advice: Provide your sales agents with the tools to succeed. The training was absolutely awful and did not set us up for success. Switch to a separate Business Development Rep and Account Executive model, rather than keeping those roles combined. Expecting agents to prospect, cold call, schedule appointments, AND demo every day is not efficient.
